news uk-news kate-middleton-shed-tear-wedding-"Kate Middletons wedding dress revisitedByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments It may have been a grand wedding with almost , guests packed into Westminster Abbey for the service, but the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge managed to make the historical day a very personal one. Kate had her sister Pippa as her maid of honour while Prince William chose his younger brother Prince Harry as his best man.Harry kept up best man tradition by giving a speech at the wedding reception - and according to many of the guests it was the highlight of the big day, evenhe did make Kate cry. Royal author Katie Nicholl gave an insight into the tear-jerking speech in her biography Harry: Le, Loss, and Love.  She said: It was affectionate, warm and funny and touched William deeply. The speech was peppered with Harryaposs classic sense of humour, and he ribbed his brother: aposWilliam didnapost have a romantic bone in his body before he met Kate, so I knew it was serious when William suddenly started cooing down the phone at Kateapos. Famous for his mimicry, Harry then impersonated his brother calling Kate aposBabykinsapos, to much laughter from the guests. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. When he said the couple’s decade-long romance was his inspiration, there was a shy smile from Chelsy, while Kate shed a tear. Kate and brother-in-law Harry previously had a jovial relationship - he even famously described Kate as the sister he never had and the pair were often seen giggling or sharing a joke at royal events.But according to royal expert Duncan Larcombe, Harry and Kateaposs sibling-like relationship is now long in the past.  It comes amid a growing feud between William and Harry and the fact that Harry and we Meghan Markle decided to quit as royals and leave the UK for Calornia. And speaking earlier this year as Kate approached her th birthday, Duncan told OK! : Kate was, as Harry said, the sister he never had and clearly that is not the case anymore.There was a time when Harry would have been instrumental in any celebrations or any fun that the couple were having, but those days are long in the past. title: miracle baby born 23 weeks
story: Miracle baby born at  weeks with % chance of survival finally goes homeLucas Chialton-Helliar was the size of a "biro pen" when he was delivered at just  weeks at LiverpoolWomens Hospital, with doctors warning the tot had a % chance of survivalSarah Chialton said Lucas is doing really well after being discharged from hospitalByOlivia WilliamsMatthew DreschNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments A miracle baby who was born at just  weeks and had a % chance of survival has finally made it home. Lucas Chialton-Helliar was the size of a biro pen when he was delivered at Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital in October last year.Mum Sarah Chialton found out she was going into early labour after telling doctors about a small amount of aposunusual dischargeapos she had noticed.Sarah, from Litherland, Merseyside, went into hospital to get examined and was told she was already dilated, the Liverpool Echo reports.The -year-old said: I was  weeks pregnant and I was in work and I noticed - because I am a nurse myself - I noticed a little bit of unusual discharge. So I rang the Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital up and they told me to come in to get examined.They thought it was down to a water infection at the time. So I went into the Womenaposs, got examined and they said I was cm dilated. Sarah was going into early labour and doctors told her thather baby was to survive delivery, there was only a % survival rate in the first few weeks of his le. The mum added: That was at  weeks and one day, so they were going through scenarios with me. They said a  week baby doesnapost have a good outcome basically.  Doctors were saying it was a % chance of survival in the first couple of weeksthe baby was to survive delivery. Lucas came into the world weighing lb oz at  weeks and four days and Sarah said he was the size of a biro pen.The baby boy went through a lot during his  day stay in hospital, including six dferent infections, sepsis, two collapsed lungs and several blood transfusions.Lucas was discharged from Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital on Sunday, March , when he was four months old.  Get all the latest news sent to your inbox.for the free Mirror newsletter Sarah and her family described Lucas as a miracle and the -year-old wanted to thank staff at the neonatal unit at Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital. She said: I want to praise the neonatal unit at the Womenaposs because they have just been amazing through this. The nurses, the doctors have all been amazing. Sarah said her placenta was sent off for tests to look into why she went into early labour but the results left doctors unsure as to why she did. The -year-old said Lucas is now doing really well since being discharged from hospital at the weekend and is currently on home oxygen. He now weighs lbs. She said: Lucas is doing well, really well. Heaposs taking feeds and bottles as well. Heaposs brilliant, heaposs doing really well. Sarah said she wanted to share her story to thank staff at Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital and to help other mums who might be going through something similar. The nurse said she wanted mums going through the same thing to know there is aposlight at the end of it. news uk-news moment-biker-screams-you-nearly-"Liverpool: CCTV captures man jump on car bonnet after incident in ChildwallByEllen KirwinAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsThis is the moment a masked vandal was caught on camera smashing a Range Rover and screaming you nearly killed me after a crash. The collision, which involved a motorbike and a Nissan, happened in Liverpool on Wednesday at about .pm.Afterwards, the motorbike was reportedly left in the middle of the road in flames after the rider ran off from the scene, LiverpoolEcho reports. Jake Carter, from Childwall, has shared Ring doorbell footage and a CCTV clip of what happened on his TikTok page after the crash happened outside his home. The -year-old claims the Silver Nissan, which was hit by the scrambler bike, belonged to a mechanic who was coming to his home to look at a car.  He claims the mechanic indicated and drove towards his house and onto his drive. However, he claims that as the driver turned into the driveway, two scrambler bikes flew up the road and smacked into the back of the Nissan. Ring doorbell footage shows one of the riders jumping on his wall and screaming: You nearly killed me lad. What were you doing   In footage shared with the ECHO, a masked person wearing a balaclava can then be seen jumping onto the bonnet of a Range Rover on the drive and smashing it with his foot. The Range Rover was not involved in the crash. Speaking over the TikTok video, which shows the CCTV footage, Jake Carter said: Three lads wearing balaclavas were extremely confrontational and aggressive to the gentleman.  The mechanic is an older guy who is lovely and he was extremely shook up [sic] by this situation. But then one of the three musketeers decides to do a little bit of a jigg on the wall before jumping onto my dadaposs car and basically kicked the windscreen in. Spiderman then jumps back on the wall before fleeing the scene on another scrambler. Jakeaposs video of the crash and the thug later vandalising his dadaposs car has been viewed on TikTok more than , times.  It was shared on his page @Jakecartermusic with the caption: Help us find who these scumbags are, someone must know something  They’re missing a scrambler now! Please share. In the video, Jake points to the ECHO article about the motorbike being left abandoned in the middle of the road. He then says: So this happened outside our house in Liverpool today and one lovely boy decided to do some bodywork to my dadaposs Jeep. Police confirmed they are aware of the incident and are appealing for information. No one was injured in the incident but both the Nissan and Range Rover were damaged.A spokesperson for Mersyside police said: We are appealing for information following a report a motorbike was on fire in Childwall this afternoon .At around .pm emergency services were called to a report that a motorbike was on fire in the middle of the road on Childwall Park Avenue, near to the Black Woods. Three males were then reported to have been seen riding off on motorbikes towards Woolton Village. There are no reports of anyone injured during the incident. Two cars, a Nissan and a Range Rover, were reported to have been damaged near to the incident. We are appealing for any witnesses, CCTV and dash camera footage which may assist the investigation.Anyone with information on this incident is asked to contact @MerPolCC on Twitter or ‘ Merseyside Police Contact Centre’ on Facebook with reference  of  March.Any one with information about the use or storage of weapons can DM @MerPolCC or @CrimestoppersUK on   . title: mum gives birth three babies
story: Mum gives birth to three babies in just  months - and theyre not tripletsStephanie Hanson has spoken on TIkTok how discovered she was pregnant with twins, just three months after giving birth to her first-born child DaphneStephanie Hanson gave birth to Rubie and Penelope some  months after welcoming Daphne into the world Image: TikTok stphmchhansByMirror:,  Mar A woman has given birth to three babies within the space of just twelve months, after falling pregnant with twins soon after having her first baby. Stephanie Hanson welcomed her first daughter, Daphne, into the world on January , . It was just three months later that she discovered she was pregnant again, and was shockingly already three weeks along.Ten months after Daphne’s birthday, she gave birth to twin daughters Rubie and Penelope - on December  of the same year, reports.Women typically only begin ovulating again around  days, or six weeks, after giving birth.So Stephanie was in total disbelief upon discovering the pregnancy test she took around this time was positive, and she was already three weeks along. “I was in a newborn fog, and [then] there was the excitement of this new relationship,” she said. “I was just adjusting to everything. She said her first thought was for little Daphne she was concerned that her first-born wouldn’t have one-on-one time with her anymore. However, Stephanie said Daphne was “delighted” upon meeting her newborn twin sisters, and wanted to give them hugs right away. The sisters are now very close, Stephanie said, sharing a room and doing everything together.  Stephanie, who is no longer with the twins’ father, shares her parenting journey on TikTok, where she shares with followers how she manages co-parenting and having three young children all very close in age. She said it’s “not always easy”, but claimed she was “the happiest [she’d] ever been in her entire le”. “These kids are the best thing that’s ever happened to me,” she said. Another video she shared on the  went over how she and her “baby daddy” were dedicated to raising happy children. While they lived in dferent homes, they were on the same team, she said. title: mum who delivered parcels extra
story: Mum who delivered parcels for extra cash quits day job now earning £, a weekAtlanta Martin, , quickly settled into her side-hustle as a delivery driver which she fit around her day job at Gatwick Airport and now earns £, a weekAtlanta Martin, , has turned her side-hustle into a flexible and lucrative careerByCharlotte Penketh-KingLaura SharmanNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsA hardworking mum who started delivering packages to make a bit of extra cash has been able to quit her day job after discovering she can earn a whopping £, a week.Atlanta Martin, , was working as a flight dispatcher at Gatwick Airport when she decided to take on another role three years ago. She quickly settled on being a delivery driver, which she could fit around her current hours at the airport and soon realised how lucrative her second job could be.The mum-of-one, from Worthing, West Sussex, did so well that she eventually decided to quit her day job after two years. She can now rake in up to a grand a week by putting in -hour days and is able to plan her schedule around her two-year-old daughter.  And the profit she has made from the delivery job is enough to fund a nice lestyle, including a recent trip to Disney World in Florida. Atlanta said: Iaposm really happy I made the decision to do this job full time. With delivering, I can choose my own hours, work as much as I wish too and earn the same money or more. It was a risk as delivering is self employed and the money is not guaranteed, but I have no regrets and it is working really well.  Atlanta worked at Gatwick prior to giving birth and realised that she could make extra money by delivering while on maternity leave. She said: I worked there for three and a half years but I have a daughter who is coming up to three years old. The hours I had to work and the sht pattern was not flexible enough at the airport. I started delivering whilst on my maternity leave as an extra form of income. Thanks to the flexibility of delivering, I found I could work the hours I wanted to around my daughter. I started posting videos of me delivering on my social media which did really well so I decided to leave my full time job so I could pursue delivering and growing my social media channels.  Since ditching the airport job, Atlanta has been putting in the hours working on her own time delivering in the car for Just Eat, Uber Eats, Deliveroo and Beelivery. She starts as early as am and works until as late as :pm - racking up around  deliveries on a busy day. Her hard work has been worth it as sheaposs been raking in the cash, making up to £, a week through delivering across the south east of England. Between February  and February  alone, she earned £. from Just Eat, £. from UberEats, £. from Deliveroo and £. from Beelivery, as well as £ in cash tips - totalling at an impressive £. in just one week.  Atlanta was amazed by the amount of money sheaposs been making alongside her boyfriend, Benjamin Hasker, , who also works as a delivery driver as well as a magician and doing Punch and Judy shows. The mum has no plans toto the airline industry and is thrilled with her new career. She said: Itaposs not guaranteed to be £, every week - the more hours you put in, the more you earn. Thanks to my hard work earning this amount of money, myself, my daughter and my partner all went to Disney World, Florida, for two weeks in December  . This was my daughteraposs first ever holiday. I have already bought two cars outright in the time that I have been delivering for work. I havenapost bought anything for my daughteraposs third birthday yet as it is in June, but we are planning to go to London for the weekend for a trip to London Zoo. Iaposm really happy I chose to pursue this as a full time career. It was a risk but I have no regrets. title: prince harry not negative queen
story: Prince Harry will not be negative about the Queen in memoir, claims biographerThe book will not be "warts and all" publication and Finding Freedom author Omid Scobie claims Harry is going "out of his way" to avoid damaging his grandmother the Queen.Prince Harry and The Queen Image: Getty ImagesByGraeme Murray:,  Mar Prince Harry has reportedly avoided being negative about the Queen in his new memoir. He is poised to publish a tell-all publication which promises to be his and Meghan Markleaposs finale moment claims their friend and unofficial biographer Omid Scobie.The book, however, will not be warts and all and the Finding Freedom author claims Harry is going out of his way to avoid damaging his grandmother the Queen, reports OK! magazine. Scobie told an episode of the Royally Obsessed podcast: Iaposve been told by sources that Harry is going out of his way to make sure there is nothing in there that could be construed as being negative towards the Queen or her reign in any way.  He added: I donapostapos think that aposwarts and allapos moment is going to happen. The book is tipped to to go on sale later this year and may royal watchers were concerned about what its contents. It was first suggested it could reveal the Princeaposs true feelings towards his step-mother Camilla while others suggested it would aposshake the monarchy to its core.  A £ million memoir deal was signed by Harry with J R Moehringer which his publishers have described as the definitive account of the experience, adventures, losses, and le lessons that have helped shape him. Harry did not warn the Royal Yamily of his decision to write a book, it has believed, which reportedly left many in the Firm aposblindsidedapos by the announcement. Prince Harry and his grandmother have always shared a particularly close bond and royals aficionados believe any revelations he does make will not include her. During Harry and Meghanaposs controversial Oprah interview he spoke of his respect for his grandmother and said that he had spoken to her a great deal recently. His we, meanwhile, spoke about how she loved being in the Monarchaposs company. She added. The Queen has always been wonderful to me, she added. title: princess diana burst laughter prince
story: Princess Diana burst into laughter at Prince Charles unromantic proposalA royal expert shared details of Prince Charles proposal to Princess Diana in the Channel  documentary Charles and Di: The Truth Behind Their Wedding, where she revealed it wasnt very romanticDiana got engaged to Prince Charles in , and the pair wed six months later Image: Tim Graham Photo Library via Getty ImagesByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsPrincess Diana and Prince Charles apos wedding was something out of a fairytale - but the proposal was anything but romantic.Diana was just  years old - more than a decade younger than her future husband - when she was invited to Windsor Castle for a visit that would change her le forever. As she arrived at the historical royal home, Charles told her he had missed her so much, before he led her to the nursery, unknowingly to her, to pop the question. Charles had only met Diana  times, but by the time she left the castle, she was engaged to the future king. Appearing on the Channel  documentary Charles and Di: The Truth Behind Their Wedding, Majesty magazine editor Ingrid Seward shared details on the not-so-romantic proposal. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. She claims the heir to the throne proposed in the nursery at Windsor Castle because the nursery is like a home. And in response Diana burst out laughing, she claims. I think that was probably just her nerves. She didnapost think it was the most romantic of proposals but she had the proposal. Royal biographer Christopher Wilson added: She was completely bowled over by this, didnapost see it coming.  He said: Prince Charles didnapost pick her up in his arms and embrace or do any of the things we might do when we propose marriage to the one that we love. He rang his mum, simply to say aposthere, Iaposve done it now. Youaposve asked me to get married to somebody and Iaposve fixed it.apos What heaposd done was heaposd finally found a we.In a later interview, Diana revealed further details about the proposal. She said: He said do you realise that one day youaposll be Queen. And I said aposI love you so much, I love you so muchapos. He said aposwhatever loves meansapos. He said it then. So I thought, that was great. I thought he meant it. And in the biography, Diana: Her True Story, the Princess reflected: A voice said to me inside, aposYou wonapost be queen but you will have a tough role... aposYes,apos I said. aposI love you so much, I love you so much.apos He said, aposWhatever love meansapos and so he ran upstairs and rang his mother.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: queen secret tunnel out windsor
story: Queen has secret tunnel out of Windsor Castle - and its hidden under the carpetThe Queens Windsor Castle home is -years-old, boasts , square feet of space, , rooms, and a very secret tunnel which she can useshe ever needs to leave without people knowingWindsor Castle Image: PAByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsThe Queen has a secret escape tunnel at Windsor Castle thataposs hidden by a trap door.The royal residence, which serves both as Her Majesty aposs working palace and private home, is packed full of history and secrets since it was built back in the th century.As well as being a lovely place for the royals to stay, it was also a fortress, which means there are lots of hidden passages and former defences. Concealed underneath a carpet in one of the homeaposs offices, youaposll find a trap door that opens out into a tunnel, which the Queen can useshe needs to make a quiet getaway.A first-ever broadcast look inside the hidden passageway was shared in a  BBC documentary, The Queenaposs Palaces, where presenter Fiona Bruce said you can still find evidence of the castle’s war-like origins”“you know where to look.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. She said: “This is an office just tucked away in a corner of Windsor Castle. But look under here. Asby magic, just lt these and the medieval castle emerges. She walks down the stone steps and gives a glimpse inside the tunnel itself. She says: If you’re a soldier in Windsor Castle under siege you need a way to get out. “And this is the secret passage. This is exactly what it looked like in the s. “It’s wide enough to accommodate a whole army of men. “You can just imagine them rushing down the stairs, and it leads out onto the street. “This is the clever bit - they’d then be able to sneak up on the enemy and attack them from behind.” The Queen isnapost the only member of the royal family whose residence has a secret tunnel. The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge live at apartment A inside Kensington Palace with their three children, Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis. The Queen gave William and Kate the keys to the residence, which they also share with the Duke and Duchess of Kent, following their royal wedding in . The apartment features five reception rooms, three main bedrooms, dressing rooms, a night and day nursery, and staff quarters.But thataposs not all. It is also reported to have a panic room and secret tunnel that Prince William and Prince Harry are said to have used to sneak out to McDonaldaposs with their mum Princess Diana. Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: three bed flat sale just
story: Three-bed flat on sale for just £, as buyers joke decorator was on LSDThe eccentric home in Glasgow is a random collection of childlike patterns and every colour of the rainbow, leaving potential buyers confusedInside the house is an interesting colour scheme Image: RightmoveByKelly-Ann MillsNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsA three-bed cottage flat has gone on sale for just £, but the buyers are warned it might give you a headache, as some joked the decorator was on LSD when he painted it. The eccentric home is a random collection of childlike patterns and every colour of the rainbow. The combination of bright hues, swirly patterns, dot work and odd, out of place shapes on the walls and ceilings gives the flat a hallucinatory feel. There are also random images of famous people such as Elvis Presley, Nelson Mandela, Marilyn Monroe and, perhaps most bizarrely, Princess Diana, on the walls. Viewers of the Rightmove home, in Glasgow, Scotland, joked it could be the abode of lentil-loving hippie character Neil Pye from cult aposs Beeb sitcom The Young Ones.Even Westgate Estate Agents admits it requires a degree of cosmetic upgrading. One viewer - known only as Steven - said: Neil from The Young Ones is selling his flat in Glasgow. The weirdest bit is the picture of Princess Di in the middle of it all. He added: It is a great spot and price. Someone will get a pretty good place once itaposs gutted. Another bloke said: The place, the view, the price.... all pretty decent. But many grands needed to remove the psychedelic, drug crazed, decor.  Gave me a headache looking at the pics. And I like mad and bold stuff. Not groovy. He also quipped: Neilaposs place is a great description of it. Heavyyy. Alison Brook joked: Thereaposs nowt wrong with that house that sunglasses or a wrecking ball couldnapost fix! One house hunter said: Holy c**p, did someone slip the decorator LSD  Another bloke - Ewan - added: Bit too Scooby Doo for me.  The estate agents present it as a development opportunity. They added: We are delighted to offer for sale this three bedroom, upper cottage flat, situated within the sought after Kingspark district of the Southside of Glasgow. Read more Requires a degree of cosmetic upgrading yet offers spacious accommodation in a popular locale. The property comprises: welcoming reception hallway, generous lounge, with a picture window, kitchen.There are three, well-proportioned bedrooms, all of which have space for additional free standing furniture as required and bathroom.The property benefits UPVC double glazed windows, gas central heating with a modern combination boiler and private gardens. title: vladimir putins odd way asking
story: Vladimir Putins odd way of asking his we to marry him which left her baffledVladimir Putins we claimed her husband was poorly-dressed on their first date, and she was left baffled by his unemotional marriage proposal, with the pair later orcingRussian President Vladimir Putin and his ex-we Lyudmila Image: ReutersByRosaleen FentonDeputy Features Editor:,  Mar Vladimir Putin has launched a devastating attack on Ukraine, in a bid to overthrow its democratically elected government. The odd, reclusive President has an intense daily schedule - and tries to keep intrusions into his personal le strictly limited.Putin married Lyudmila Shkrebneva in  and the couple had two daughters, Mariya and Yekaterina. Although he is notoriously secretive about his personal le, the couple announced their separation in a staged television interview in June . The orce was later confirmed by Lyudmilaaposs name being removed from Putinaposs official biography on the Kremlin website, so his biography simply mentions their children instead. In his  biography aposFirst Personapos, which contains a series of interviews with the Russian president and figures close to him, Lyudmila shared details of their relationship. In a frank chat, she revealed that she didnapost think much of the poorly dressed man she met outside a theatre while on a double date.Follow all todayaposs latest updates on the conflict with our live blog But the pair continued to keep in touch after Putin gave her his phone number - a rare move for the privacy-obsessed KGB officer. After three-and-a-half years, Putin proposed, but his subdued manner left Lyudmila convinced he was actually trying to dump her. She took the interviewee: One night we were sitting this house and he said, You know what kind of person I am by now. In general, Iaposm not very easygoing. He was being self-critical. He explained that he was the silent type that he was rather abrupt in some things and he could even insult people, and so on. He was saying that he was a risky le partner. And he added: In three and a half years, you have probably made up your mind. It sounded to me like we were breaking up. aposYes, Iaposve made up my mind,apos I said. He let out a doubtful aposYes apos Then I was sure that that was it, we were breaking up. But then he said, aposWell thenthat is the way it is, I love you and propose we get married.apos So it all came as a complete surprise to me. news us-news meghan-markle-prince-harry-slam-"Meghan Markle and Prince Harry speak at Global Citizen LiveByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsPrince Harry and Meghan Markle are among those who have slammed the UK and other countries for not lting intellectual property rules when it comes to the Covid- vaccine.The couple are among  signatories of an open letter that says self-defeating nationalism, pharmaceutical monopolies and inequality stand in our way of ending the pandemic. The letter, which was published today, says the pandemic is not over and that the approach to vaccine equity is immoral, entirely self-defeating and also an ethical, economic and epidemiological failure.It says: The European Union, the United Kingdom, and Switzerland continue to block the lting of intellectual property rules which would enable the redistribution and scale-up of Covid- vaccines, test and treatment manufacturing in the global south. The transfer of largely publicly funded vaccine technology and know-how from pharmaceutical corporations would fast track production to a matter of months. Yet still today, a handful of these corporations retain the power to dictate vaccine supply, distribution and price – and the power to decide who lives and who dies. World leaders, and particularly rich nations, have the responsibility to change this situation and ensure the publicly funded vaccine technology and know-how is available to the global south. The letter, which comes on the second anniversary of Covid- being declared a pandemic, is also signed by actress Charlize Theron, former UK Prime Minister Gordon Brown and former Secretary-General of the United Nations Ban Ki-moon.Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up . Meanwhile, it was also revealed today that the coupleaposs Archewell Foundation has pledged its support to The Peopleaposs Vaccine Alliance - a non-profit organisation that wants everybody across the world to have access to Covid vaccine, tests and treatments. Itaposs unknown how much they have invested. Their investment in the campaign was announced today on The Peopleaposs Vaccine Alliance Twitter page, which said it was proud to welcome Meghan and Harryaposs support.The tweet said: We are proud to welcome Archewell Foundation to the Alliance and appreciate their support, alongside Prince Harry and Meghan, The Duke and Duchess of Sussex.We will work together to end vaccine inequity and ensure COVID- vaccines, treatments and tests are available to everyone.Both Harry and Meghan have spoken out about vaccine equity in the past and last May, Harry made an appearance at Vax Live - a concert in Calornia to promote the sharing of vaccines.The couple has also previously written an open letter to the chief executives of pharmaceutical companies like Pfizer, Moderna and AstraZeneca urging them to redouble their support for the UN-sponsored Covax vaccine equity programme.And last September, during a mini-tour in New York City, the couple appeared at the at Global Citizen Live event in Central Park. During the event, Meghan said: “Every single person on this planet has a fundamental right to get this vaccine but thataposs not happening. “It is wrong that so much of the vaccine supply has only gone to just ten wealthy nations and not everyone , itaposs just not OK.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Meghan MarklePrince HarryRoyal Family" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: best dog trims crufts 2020
story: Best dog haircuts at Crufts  - show-stopping styles and silky coatsCrufts , the worlds largest dog show, has entered its second day and spectators just cant get enough of the adorable dogs wandering around the show with their owners in towAn adorable old English sheepdog with cheek buns Image: GettyByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsAs Crufts makes its highly-anticipated , dog owners have been descending on Birmingham to show off their precious pooches. While there can only be one Best in Show, countless dogs have been impressing spectators with their silky coats, charming temperaments and outstanding obedience. Made to look their best, many dogs have been treated to a trip to the groomers before their arrival at the worldaposs largest dog show, with some even showing up in dog-friendly clothing and accessories. To celebrate all things Crufts, we are sharing the show-stopping dog with the best trims who are sure to turn heads at this yearaposs competition.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.  Spotted on the grooming table at the National Exhibition Centre, an old English sheepdog has been making spectators smile with their adorable cheeky buns and top knot. A brown Hungarian Puli, which has one of the most striving coats in the show ring, was seen snuggling with its owner as she made him show ready. According to The Kennel Club, the breed owes its origins to Hungarian herding dogs of the Far East, which accompanied the Magyars as they travelled west.  A statement reads: One of the Hungarian corded breeds, the puppy coat of loose flocks later cords naturally and provides insulation and protection. Underneath the coat the dog is lightly built and his nimble movement and agility made him fit for . Elsewhere, an adorable poodle was spotted on the grooming table before judges arrived to rate its spectacular coat, and a cheeky Afghan hound was seen having its hair brushed to look its best before its competition category.  When the competition ends on Sunday, Crufts will have been broadcasting for a record-breaking  hours across the UK on Channel and More. The celebrations officially kicked off at the launch on March , with Paralympics presenter, Sophie Morgan, announced as the new face of Crufts. Sophie said: Iaposm so happy Crufts is back! Every dog has its day at this amazing event and these three breeds making history are among them.  Almost all breeds will be represented at this yearaposs four-day event - including the smooth-faced Pyrenean Sheepdog who will be competing for the Best in Show title at Crufts for the first time ever. A Crufts statement reads: Organised by The Kennel Club, the show celebrates every aspect of the role that dogs play in our lives. Crufts has changed in ways that couldn’t possibly have been imagined when the show was set up in Victorian times by the late Charles Cruft.  Although it was a very dferent event in , Charles Cruft was a great showman and would surely have enjoyed the size and scope of the event today, which has become an essential date in any dog lover’s calendar. The dog show is still an important part of the event, celebrating the unique relationship that dogs share with their owners. Judges are trained to ensure that only healthy dogs win prizes, which in turn encourages the breeding of healthy dogs. Do you have a cute dog story to share  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. title: influencer debunks how perfect bikini
story: Influencer debunks how perfect bikini snaps are taken - and shares real bum insteadA body-positive Instagram star has been praised for her refreshing honesty, debunking how influencers taking the perfect bikini and highlighting how social media isnt always realityHayley has a very important message to share with followersByJulia BanimAudience WriterSamantha BartlettSenior Lestyle  Travel Reporter:,  Mar |comments As much as we might try and remind ourselves that social media isnapost reflective of reality, knowing full well that we shouldnapost beat ourselves up for falling short of aposperfectionapos, is easier said than done at times.So itaposs always good when a bonafide influencer comes forward to lt the curtain on what actually goes into getting those impossibly aposperfectapos shots, reminding you that what you see in the bathroom mirror is just as beautul.As previously reported by theDaily Star,personal trainer Hayley Madigan - who champions all things reality, health, body confidence and fitness - has now come forward to expose the truth on how certain influencers get their butt looking a certain way, using her own bottom as an example. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.Using side-by-side pics, Hayley - who goes by the username @ hayleymadiganfitness - showed the dference between an Insta Pool Pose Vs What I see in the bathroom mirror, showing a posed pic next to what her bum looks like in reality.In a powerful caption, Hayley explained: Dferent poses, dferent camera angles, dferent posture, dferent lighting can all make a huge dference to how a body is perceived and more specically how you see your own body! You will see your body in all types of angles and poses. You will see your body relaxed and unposed. You will see yourself in many ways so do not let your eyes deceive you by telling you to feel negative towards your own body.  She continued: You have the power to change your mindset, to look at your own body in a kinder manner. To be kinder to yourself and to your mental health. To be kinder to your body, because it is your home and you only have one so treat it with the best kindness you can offer! We often pick holes in our bodies continuously but when you realise that no one worth having in your le wouldn’t ever pick those same holes about you is an important thing to remember. The people that care and love you do not see you the same way, all they see is the happiness, the love, and the sparkle that you bring to them and the world. You’re not just a body, you are YOU, so be kinder to yourself. Many people have been greatly touched by Hayleyaposs wise words, which are so very important in an age where le filtered through a social media lens can seriously impact the way we view our bodies.One person thanked Hayley for bringing some honesty to Instagram, really admire you for this, while another described her honesty as inspiring.A third person remarked that they wished such pics were shown in high schools, adding: I speak for myself around that age, I only saw the ‘perfect’ Instagram bodies. It’s easy to lose track of what is picture-perfect and what is real. I’d rather see everyday-perfect than picture-perfect more. Because we are perfect in our own way: every. single. one. of. us.Do you have a body positivity story to share  We pay for stories. title: i put full face make
story: I put on a full face of make-up to go home after C-section - I wanted to look goodA TikToker who goes by the name Zee Zee has shared her make-up routine after giving birth via C-section - and it includes contouring, eyeshadow and even  lashesZee Zee posted about how she wanted to make herself feel good after her C-section Image: @mamazeezeee TikTokByJessica TaylorReal Le Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsAlthough mothers adore their children, itaposs safe to say theyaposd all agree bringing their little ones into the world was no walk in the park. Going through labour and giving birth is just about the most painful experience a woman can go through - and many women are left traumatised afterwards. And when it comes to taking the baby home, a new mumaposs mind will be all over the place, worrying about car seats, sleeping and night feeds. So for most mums, the idea of putting on a full face of make-up just after giving birth would barely enter their headspace. But one new mum on TikTok begs to dfer. The mother, who goes by the name Zee Zee, filmed herself getting ready to leave the hospital after giving birth via C-section - but not before she put her war paint on. For more of the news you care about straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here The mum, who posts under the handle @mamazeezee, filmed herself drawing on her eyebrows, putting on primer, applying foundation, and then contouring her face. She also applies eyeshadow, blusher and highlighter before completing her look with mascara. In another shot, the new mum chows down a delicious-looking taco, with the caption: Break time, Iaposm hungry. After replenishing her energy supply, Zee Zee then pulls out her lashes and glue and applies those too. Finally, she applies lip liner and lipstick before putting a setting spray on her face.  In the final shot, Zee Zee turns the camera to face her boyfriend, who has been watching her apply her make-up while he holds the baby, with a baffled look on his face. She writes: My boyfriend judging me. In another video, Zee Zee, who has a knack for make-up, films herself applying a full face once again when she gets home - and she even curls her locks to complete the look. People impressed with her skills commented on her videos to tell Zee Zee they would have done exactly the same thing. One woman wrote: I hope I have this same energy after this baby in July. Another said: So happy seeing women take such good care of themselves after having a baby get it girl! But most people were baffled at how Zee Zee could have managed to put on a full face of make up so soon after a C-section. One wrote: After my C section I was Living like a grandma, the pain was terrible i couldnapost take care of my self well done girl you are amazing [sic] Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON HospitalsGiving birthViral" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: i tried sushi cereal wasnt
story: Exclusive: I tried sushi cereal - it wasnt awful, but I couldnt stomach it every morningA new limited-edition cereal range has been launched celebrating three of Britains best-loved takeaway dishes: Sushi Roll, Margarita Pizza, and Chicken Katsu CurryI tried Sushi Roll, Margarita Pizza, and Chicken Katsu Curry flavoured cereal Image: DeliverooByJulia BanimAudience Writer:,  Mar |commentsIf asked to describe the taste of cereal, you will most likely imagine subtle wheaty textures, with maybe a bit of dried fruit or chocolate mixed inyou fancy a treat. Itaposs doubtful that additions such as tuna, olives, or turmeric will so much as cross your mind, with many of us preferring milder tastes before weaposve finished that all-important first cup of coffee.However, Deliveroo has rolled out a limited-edition trio of inventively savoury breakfast cereals, each one celebrating a popular takeaway dish.While stocks last, customers in London, Bristol, and Manchester can order a £ box of ‘DeliverOO’s’, selecting from a choice of Sushi Roll, Margherita Pizza, and Chicken Katsu Curry. Weaposve given the bizarre range a go for ourselves - and this is what we thought. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Margherita Pizza CerealI for one have had many a cold leftover pizza slice for breakfast in my time, so didn’t think this one would present too much of a challenge. However, I did hesitate a bit before pouring the milk into the bowl of tiny puff buckwheat kernels.The tomatoey taste comes through quite strongly here - more so than the cheese - but certainly isn’t unpleasant, and thereaposs also a subtle suggestion of basil oil which gives it a surreal rustic Italian feel. Of course, itaposs quite weird to get the familiar taste of doughy, rippable pizza crust encased inside such light - and quickly quite mushy - grain, but this certainly makes for a fun novelty. Out of the three, this undoubtedly tasted the most like the takeaway it was meant to represent, but Iaposm not sure I could stomach it every day, and I didnapost end up finishing the bowl.  Chicken Katsu CurryCereal Katsu curry is one of my all-time favourite takeaway dishes and I was seriously worried that trying a twisted version of it might spoil it for me a bit. I needn’t have feared. I sampled a few of the crunchy maize flakes dry before tucking in properly, and can honestly say that Iaposd happily chow down this product like a bag of crisps. I enjoy anything spicy, and this has a little kick to it that - although not everyoneaposs cup of tea at  am - tickled my taste buds nicely. The curry powder comes through quite strongly here, but the milk pleasantly balances it out, bringing a nice cooling effect. This was my favourite out of the trio by quite a long way, and I found myself munching down spoonful after spoonful.  Sushi RollCereal Now, admittedly this is the one I feared the most. Don’t get me wrong, I love sushi, but the very thought of mixing fish and rice up in a bowl of milk first thing in the morning - even in cereal form - just didn’t sit right with me.I poured a few of the puffed brown rice kernels into the bowl and had a tentative nibble. The overall sushi flavouring came through much more vigorouslythan I thought it would, while a distinct note of wasabi took me by surprise.There was also a strong gingery aftertaste. The brown rice texture went well with this, but it wasn’t screaming cereal to me. After stalling for a minute, I poured a glug of milk into the bowl and held my breath. It was by no means awful, although perhaps not something I could regularly rush down before a morning commute. The milk didn’t compliment the cereal quite as well as it did with the Katsu onebut it was undoubtedly an interesting addition to my breakfast and I was left impressed by the realistically fresh flavour. Okay, so I donapost think Iaposll be switching from my Crunchy Nut Cornflakes anytime soon, but this trio of cereals certainly made for one of the most adventurous breakfasts Iaposve had in a while.A Deliveroo spokespersonsaid: When we heard it was World Cereal Day, we wanted to ‘bowl’ over cereal lovers with a breakfast dish to remember. We know our customers love to try weird and wonderful fusion dishes - which is why we’ve really milked it with this range of cereals.If you live in Manchester, Bristol or London, search ’DeliverOO’s’ in the app and for a bargain £ a pack, you can take a break from cereal monogamy and try something deliciously dferent for breakfast this week.If you fancy giving these unusual cereals a go, you can search ‘DeliverOO’s: Food Flavoured Cereal Shop’ on the Deliveroo app, or online to place an order. Subject to location and availability. title: man disturbed house rightmove 189k
story: Man disturbed by house on Rightmove for £k - as its got crime scene tape insideA house hunter was left feeling disturbed after browsing properties on Rightmove and coming across a three-bedroom property for £, that he thought had crime scene tape insideThe house for sale is on the market for £, Image: RightmoveByCourtney PochinSenior Audience WriterLucas Cumiskey:,  Mar |commentsWhen looking at properties for sale online, house hunters will likely have a list of requirements for their ideal home. And theyaposll also have some things that will put them off a place almost instantly. For one man, spotting what he thought to be aposcrime scene tapeapos inside a three-bedroom terraced home for sale in Preston, wasnapost a big selling point.The man was looking through Rightmove when he came across the house, which is on the market for £,.Images on the listing show that the toilet, taps in the bathroom, kitchen, fridge, fireplaces and even the boiler are covered in blue and white hazard-style tape similar to that used by homicide police.  One concerned viewer said: I found this property on Rightmove. And itaposs covered in police crime scene tape. Did the seller estate agent not think about removing it first  However, on closer inspection, it seems all is not as it initially appears as the tape is emblazoned with aposDo not useapos, whereas crime scene tape often features cordons splashed with aposPoliceapos or aposPolice line do not crossapos. There is no suggestion the pad in Preston, Lancs, was actually a crime scene. On the contrary, Taylors Estates claims the address is quite the steal as it has two bathrooms and boasts views of the River Ribble.  The estate agent adds: With parking available at the front of the property on the road, the house offers a small front courtyard style garden which leads to the front door and into an entrance vestibule. Continuing into the property and into the main hall you are met with the main open staircase on the left-hand side of the building and your first reception room on the right which boasts a great bay window to allow a flood of light. In the middle of the house sits the second reception room with a good-sized kitchen dinner to the rear of the house and utility sitting at the back. The back garden again is a small but cosy sized courtyard. The first floor houses the three double bedrooms with the master at the front of the house which is accompanied by an ensuite with toilet and walk-in shower. The house was added to Rightmove on Monday.Do you have a story to sell  We want to hear all about it. title: man jokily writes naughty dogs
story: Man jokily writes naughty dogs name in mud after she destroys living roomThe Great Dane covered her owners cream carpets in soil but Sam Roberts saw the funny side to his dogs creation - and even signed her name in the artwork when cleaning it upNelly wrecked her owners living room while he was out Image: Triangle NewsByLucas CumiskeyPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Mar |commentsWhen welcoming a dog into your home, owners should expect a certain level of destruction to unfold courtesy of their new four-legged friend.But one owner got more than he bargained for after his Great Dane trashed his house while he was out. Shocked Sam Roberts came home to find his dog - called Nelly - had gone barking mad and wrecked his living room.He had only popped out for a few hours and left her unattended. But the bored -month-old pooch tore up a plant with soil covering the cream carpet and the sofa messed up. The pup - sporting a cone collar - looked sheepish about the destruction she had caused.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.She was lying on a mound of the mess, atop an upturned sofa cushion, with the soil, shredded plant leaves and other chewed up trinkets scattered around. But the -year-old saw the funny side and even wrote his pet’s name in the soil for a laugh while cleaning up. A dramatic after snap shows Nelly snuggling up on the sofa in a tidied up living room. The HGV mechanic said: “We left Nelly on her own for a couple of hours.“She had fun to say the least.” Sam, of Conwy, north Wales, added: “We were that shocked that we just laughed to be honest “We have been leaving her quite a bit for four hours ish and she’s good as gold, and last Saturday we left her for three hours and that’s what happened.” Fellow Great Dane owners shared their own horror stories in reaction to Nelly’s antics. One woman said: “Been there, done that and after his total destruction he had absolute atomic poo-poos all through the house. “One look at his adorable face and all was forgiven, had me totally wrapped around his giant paws.” Another added: “That lampshade cone obviously did all the damage. Great job on cleaning up! Glad to see the sofa and carpet survived so well!” A third woman quipped: “Jeez, Iaposm so pleased sheaposs OK and survived the house tornado.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Great DaneTeamDogsDogsAnimals" data-immediate"data-immediate"Calling all dog lovers!to TeamDogs for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.Invalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: schoolboy praised getting job can
story: Schoolboy praised for getting job so he can take crush out on McDonalds dateA -year-old schoolboy has been declared "an old-fashioned gent" after he earned enough money washing his uncles fleet of vehicles to take his crush out on a date to McDonaldsWhen Lee Robinson received a text from his nephew asking about odd jobs, he had an idea Image: Kennedy News and MediaByJulia BanimAudience WriterNia Price:,  Mar |comments When Lee Robinson received a text from his -year-old nephew Lloyd Catlow, asking whether there were any odd jobs he could do for him in exchange for pocket money, he decided to invite him over to his workplace.Lee, who works as operations director of a commercial cleaning service company, says young Lloyd spent a good two hours washing six of his vehicles and was left over the moon with his £ earnings.The teenager had apparently never thought of asking for money for free, and would have rather earned a few quid through hard work so that he could take a girl he liked out on a date to McDonaldaposs. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Lee, of Colne, Lancashire, was so left impressed with Lloydaposs positive attitude and fantastic overall work that he offered him a regular job at his company.Going forward, Lloyd will be cleaning his uncleaposs vehicles every month in exchange for some hard-earned cash. His work ethic has clearly already paid off, as he was able to treat his crush to an upgraded date at a local milkshake parlour.Lee, , has since praised his nephewaposs work ethic online, in a post that has clocked up more than , likes and comments. The proud uncle explained: Lloyd just messaged me out of the blue and said that he wanted to take this young lady to McDonaldaposs and askedI had any work for him. I was really buzzing because Iaposve always had a job since I was , paper rounds and whatnot. Heaposs always expressed an interest in being a Saturday boy, earning a bit of money, and having a job to pay for his boxing classes and stuff like that. He never even had an inkling towards receiving any money for free. I said aposno problem, Iaposll find you something. Iaposm sure you can wash the vans and get them ready to goapos.Weaposre going to invite him back every month to do the vans inside and out, so heaposs gained himself a job from it, by just having that little bit of initiative and asking. Itaposs sort of the message that you want to send across really, it was just a chance message and I work in sales and operations so I see that day-to-day - Iaposll e-mail a client aposhow are you doing  We havenapost seen each other for a whileapos and sometimes it can turn into a job. I just wanted to show that to him, itaposs about getting off of your backside and he seems to be wanting to work and he showed that, I was really over the moon for him. Iaposve got two boys and a girl and I hope that they have that same ethic and drive that heaposs got, which is really good for a young lad. Speaking about his work, Lloyd said: It felt really good to finally be able to take the young lady out and it was just so much better with it being money that I earned myself through hard work. Meanwhile, a LinkedIn post written by Lee about his hardworking nephew has seen the youngster heaped with praise and hailed as an aposold-fashioned gentapos. Kim Billy Leipold commented: This is indeed inspirational. I used to do this when I was a kid, but not with car washing instead in our shoe factory. I help every weekend and summer vacations to earn money, helping to put on shoelaces, polish shoes and box them. As my parents taught meI was something I have to earn it either with good grades or by working! This kid will be in the future very successful! Kudos Kid! Christopher Brazell wrote: This is phenomenal! If he continues in this way, heaposs not going to need to be calling around asking for work, people will be calling him. Great job goes to the young man, and also the family who influences an incredible attitude towards work and reward. Hats off to you! And great job picking the milkshake place over McDonaldaposs! Another win for the young man, his parents, and the young lady! Good stuff!Do you have a heartwarming story to share  We pay for stories. title: woman hysterics shaving blunder leaves
story: Woman in hysterics as shaving blunder leaves dog looking like a money boxAn accidental shaving gaffe led to a golden retriever resembling a dog charity money box and looking pretty sad about it after she moved her head into the shaverRach accidentally saved a patch on her dogs headByJohn BettAudience WriterCharles Wade-PalmerReporter:,  Mar |comments A dog owner left their golden retriever looking like a charity money box after a shaving accident left the pooch with a notch on her head. Rach Sharpe shared the hilarious mistake on Facebook to the group Golden Retrievers UK where dog lovers responded in fits of laughter, as the Daily Star reports.She said she was trying to give her partner a trim and the dog approached and she slipped with the shaver, leaving the pet with a distinct notch in her head. With the slot, the dog looked exactly like the iconic Guide Dogs for the Blind charity box, and Rach, from Gloucester, was left in stitches. What do you think about Rachaposs shaving mishap  Let us know in the comments...Taking to Facebook, Rach said: Was trimming my husbandaposs beard and she came up behind me I was like oh yeah I’ll shave the dogand she moved her head and now has this line in her head. She looks like a money box and I can’t even look at her without crying. One person commented: Insert coin, dispense wags. A second wrote: There should be treats in the shape of coins. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. And a third joked: A penny for her thoughts  Other puns thrown in on the thread included: Doge coin and I need her  cents for ious reasons.Meanwhile, a dog nicknamed Mr Ugly, is searching for a new home after being found alone on a mountain. The five-year-old dog, who is completely blind, was taken in by Blind Dog Rescue UK after spending a year wandering alone on a mountainside.He was in a really bad way with hardly any fur on his body when he was picked up by the rescue. Actually called Vincent, the lonely dog is hoping somebody in the UK will come forward to offer in a place in their home. A spokesperson from Blind Dog Rescue UK said: Introducing the gorgeous Vincent who has the unfortunate nickname of Mr Ugly at the shelter. news weird-news woman-left-red-faced-after-"TikToker regrets botched eyeliner tattooByJohn BettAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments A woman decided to save some time and money by getting her eyeliner permanently tattooed onto her face - but she soon regretted it and wanted it removed.Permanent make-up is all the rage at the minute with people paying to get their favourite designs done by a tattooist, so they donapost need to redo it every single day. TikTok star Abby shared a video of her mishap online, saying that the tattoo artist botched her inking and left her with wobbly, uneven lines.In her social media video, Abby explained that she now wants to get her eyeliner tattoo removed, and wrote online OMG, help! What do you think about Abbyaposs tattoo  Let us know in the comments... Sharing her story on TikTok, where she uploads as @abby, Abby wrote: Thought it would be a good idea to get tattoo eyeliner and this is the outcome. OMG help.She captioned the video: Yes itaposs permanent. Currently in the process of having it removed #tattooeyeliner #botched. Abbyaposs video soon had thousands of views and people commented to say they had been through a similar experience. One wrote: Ha ha, I did the same... eight years later and it’s still on.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere.Meanwhile, a woman shocked her fans on social media after revealing she spent  minutes every day doing her eyelashes - as some thought they look like spiders.TikTok user Brenna said that of her face of make-up, her eyelashes were the most important bit to get right - and one mistake ruins her whole look.She would spend up to  minutes each day applying mascara and wanted to get it just right and had her own particular style that she loved. But not everyone enjoyed her look, as some said her eyelashes were too thick and spindly - and one social media user even said they looked like spider legs. title: womans three days horror after
story: Womans three days of horror after dog swallows her wedding ringOwner Shyler Brianne Kraus was unable to play with Finn while working from home but not wanting to take not right now as an answer, the cheeky pooch plotted his revengeFinn ate his owners ring when her back was turned Image: Shyler Brianne KrausByPaige FreshwaterContent Editor:,  Mar |commentsWhen welcoming a dog into your home, you sign yourself up as their primary care giver, meaning youaposre responsible for keeping them happy and healthy. While theyaposre able to provide you with unconditional love and companionship, they cannot clean up after themselves and rely on you to collect their aposofferingsapos dotted around the garden.But one owner got more than she bargained for when it comes to poo picking-up duties, as she ended up mushing her dogaposs waste for three and a half days straight in search for her missing wedding ring.Owner Shyler Brianne Kraus, who works from home, was in the midst of an important Zoom call when her dog, Finn, was playing with his toys in another room. She said: Usually my working from home consists of him still getting whatever attention he wants but since this was such an important meeting, I wasn’t doting on him like I normally would.to our TeamDogs newsletter for your weekly dose of dog news, pictures and stories.  Halfway through the meeting I could hear him playing with something metallic because I could hear the little ting sounds from his teeth and nails. I’m not sure how I knew but in the moment I just knew it was my wedding ring. He did what any rational-thinking puppy would do -eat the most valuable item in my possession in order to teach me a lesson. I left my wedding ring on my bedside table, a mistake I no longer make, and he was able to hop up onto my bed and snatch it. Kind of a aposI’ll show her! She can’t work when I want to playapos. Seconds after Shyleraposs meeting ended, Finn wandered into the room and sat behind her impatiently waiting for her to start playing with him. After an unsuccessful search for her wedding ring, she ended up rushing Finn to the vets to get an X-ray. Despite being fed a bunch of high-fibre food at the vets, Finn did not make any aposofferingsapos, and Shyler was told to go home and examine his poo until her rings shows up. Thursday night: no ring. Friday morning: no ring. Friday midday: no ring, said Shyler, from Decatur, Illinoi. We brought him back to the vets office for another X-ray to be safe and to schedule a aposjust in caseapos X-ray for Mondayhe hadn’t produced it over the weekend. All weekend long, I mushed poo pile after poo pile. I’ve never been so grateful to have a mask to wear and still my dog’s stomach remained my grossest jewellery box. On Monday, a very stressful day for us, we discovered that after three and a half days my ring had started to make the journey to Finn’s forbidden zone. Thanks to my mother-in-law’s incredible cooking, my father-in-law always throwing Finn an extra treat or two, and my husband’s frantic games of fetch and ball catch, we got the ring back! Dramatic Finn was unknowingly just  minutes away from being taken back to the vets to undergo a surgery to remove the ring.Shyler added: Special thanks to the team at Northgate Pet Clinic- Decatur, IL who went above and beyond for my little furry terror and helped me see the humour in the situation with these X-ray pictures.He’s actually quite the legend at the vet’s office now too! Do you have a funny dog story to sell  Email paige.freshwater@reachplc. title: inside luxury life putins secret
story: Exclusive: Inside the luxury le of Putins secret girlfriend as Ukraine goes through hellOlympic gold medal-winning gymnast Alina Kabaeva, , reportedly travelled to a very private and very secure chalet near Lugano in Switzerland with her young children while Russia invaded UkraineVladimir Putin and Alina Kabaeva Image: Polaris   eyevineByTom Parry in Lugano, Switzerland:,  Mar |commentsIn spotlessly-clean streets that weave between Cartier, Gucci and Louis Vuitton stores, mega-rich Russians stroll with their pampered pooches.Far from the murderous cruelty destroying Ukrainian cities, the opulent Swiss lakeside idyll of Lugano is rumoured to be where Vladimir Putin ’s lover has been holed up since her partner started his devastating invasion. Olympic gold medal-winning gymnast Alina Kabaeva - once described as “ Russia ’s most flexible woman“ - reportedly travelled to a “very private and very secure” chalet near here with the couple’s young children as the tanks rolled in.Widely believed to be the mother of Putin’s two sons and a daughter - or possibly two daughters - Kabaeva, , lives in a luxurious bubble, shielded from the horrors her -year-old partner is inflicting on innocent children.  Switzerland has a long history of providing low-tax secrecy to the world’s most powerful. Here, the Kremlin tyrant’s family is unlikely to be exposed.A source in Lugano, close to the Italian border, said: “Before the coronavirus pandemic there was often gossip about Putin’s mistress being in town. They are known to have strong connections here, but anyone who knows them has been sworn to secrecy.“While Russia falls apart because of the sanctions, this is the perfect place for Putin to send Alina and their kids.” Claims of Putin’s links to Lugano first surfaced seven years ago. In February , a local TV station reported that Kabeava had given birth at a private VIP maternity clinic in Sorengo, on the periphery of the city.  They were said to have reserved two rooms at the discreet private maternity hospital Clinic Sant’Anna - a favourite of wealthy Russians. One suite was for the birth the second for family and bodyguards. According to insiders, President Putin was present. The Kremlin, of course, dismissed the rumours, as it does any query about Putin’s private le. Kabaeva, one of the most decorated rhythmic gymnasts in history, has never confirmed whether they have one daughter, or twin girls. Likewise, neither has ever addressed claims they got married in a secret ceremony after Putin orced his first we. Bathed in balmy spring sunshine this week, the contrast between the restful serenity of the Sant’Anna and the maternity hospital bombed by Russian troops in Mariupol, Ukraine, could not be more stark.High-end clients drove expensive vehicles into an underground car park beneath a carefully manicured lawn, with a topiaried flamingo at the entrance. Birdsong could be heard in the little vineyard nearby. Meanwhile shells still pounded Mariupol at the other end of Europe, after heavily pregnant mums had been carried out on stretchers through the rubble. In Lugano’s glistening Piazza Della Rorma, where Kabeava is said to have been seen on occasions, grey-haired men stroll past the café terraces with statuesque supermodel girlfriends. Occasional snippets of Russian puncture predominantly Italian background chatter. It is a sedate place dominated by banks, pharmacies and designer goods, and restaurants with eye-wateringly expensive menus.  Above Lake Lugano, modernist four-storey villas with infinity pools are embedded into the mountains. Their owners drive directly onto the roof, and go downstairs in private elevators. These are perfect properties for people wanting to keep clear of prying eyes, Alina Kabaeva is not the only person close to Putin with links to Lugano. Oligarch Alexey Mordashov, Russia’s second-richest man with a personal fortune estimated at £bn last year, was added to the EU sanctions list last week. Steel and mining baron Mordashov, , was targeted because of Rossiya Bank, in which he has a stake.  Rossiya was described as the “personal bank” of Russian officials who benefited from the annexation of Crimea from Ukraine in . The EU also said it believes media businesses Mordashov is invested in helped destabilise Ukraine through pro-Russian television stations. The export arm of Mordashov’s steel and mining empire, Severstal, is located in an anonymous office building in a drab industrial park in Manno, on the outskirts of Lugano. Mordashov’s below-the-radar presence is marked only on a list of business names on a sign in the car park. Last week the billionaire’s private jet was tracked as flying back to the Seychelles from Moscow. In a statement, Mordashov said he did not understand how his name was on the sanctions list, adding: “I have absolutely nothing to do with the emergence of the current geopolitical tension.”  Calling for an end to the current war, he went on: “It is terrible that Ukrainians and Russians are dying, people are suffering hardships, the economy is collapsing.” Russia’s richest .% - who together possess wealth greater than the remaining .% of the population - are not only attracted by Switzerland’s pleasant climate and stunning vistas. Recent data shows that around a third of their bank balances worldwide are in the Alpine nation. According to a  survey by ErnstYoung, banks in Zurich and Geneva are favoured by the oligarchs. Putin’s childhood friend from St Petersburg, Gennady Timchenko, was based in Switzerland until , when he was sanctioned by the US over the Crimean invasion. When Russia invaded Ukraine a fortnight ago, Timchenko was one of the first oligarchs sanctioned by Britain. Much of his wealth derived from being granted an oil export licence by Putin, his ice hockey buddy, in . He still owns a gigantic mansion on Lake Geneva. Like upmarket Belgravia in London, Switzerland has long been a playground for Putin’s oligarch friends with their limitless wealth. For Alina Kabaeva and Putin’s unseen children, it could also remain the ideal bolthole while her despot partner keeps shelling innocent civilians. Previously given high-profile political appointments because of her relationship, she is accustomed to obeying her bullying partner. As global outrage against Putin’s despicable war gets louder, the Ferraris and Lamborghinis still purr around Lake Lugano. title: little girl beautiful voice made
story: Little girl with beautul voice made the world weep for children of UkraineThere has never been a more powerful version of Let It Go, Polly Hudson says of the footage from an underground bunker, reminding us how lives have been turned upside down for millions of innocentsAmelia singing in the bunker Image: PAopinionByPolly Hudson:,  Mar |commentsIt’s the chaos surrounding her that you notice first. The ­desperate families squeezed in, standing, sitting, lying wherever they can, next to their precariously piled ­belongings, packed into the dank underground space they now call home. There’s an air of restlessness, a palpable sense of tension and anxiety. How could there not be And then, completely unexpectedly, something magical happens. Little Amelia – age unknown, but probably, what, seven or eight  – stands up on a chair. She’s wearing a sparkly jumper with stars on it, from HM a few years ago – my friend’s daughter has the same one and still loves it too. Hands clenched together shyly, unbrushed hair pulled back into a ponytail, Amelia plucks up all her courage, opens her mouth and starts to sing Let It Go, from Frozen. And like a spell cast in the movie her song comes from, the Kyiv shelter falls silent. Everyone turns and gives this small blonde scrap of a girl their mesmerised full attention. No one moves. Babies stop crying. This captive audience cannot take their eyes off her, as they listen to her sweet, steady voice, a chink of shining light in the unimaginable ­darkness of Ukraine.She has given these people the gt of focusing on something other than the living nightmare they’re enduring, albeit briefly, and there isn’t a dry eye in the room. Or from any of the millions around the globe who have since watched the video on social media.Despite probably never having heard Ukrainian before, the song is in the universal language of Disney, kids from any country in the world watching it could name that tune in three. In the caption, the woman who posted it explains that Amelia told her she wanted to be “a singer on a grand stage” – an ambition now fulfilled, just not in a way anyone would want. Their poor parents can, at least, try to fight back, but the children of Ukraine are utterly defenceless in this war. Putin is torturing and traumatising these pure, faultless human beings, turning them into orphans. Murdering  of them.  Amelia and the other kids in that shelter, and similar ones across the country. Danya and Mpak, the boys trapped in Calais, denied entry by our callous government because they don’t have the right paperwork. The -year-old who braved a -mile journey to safety alone. Heroic President Volodymyr Zelensky’ s own children – Aleksandra, , and Kiril, age nine – who have targets on their backs. Polina, the girl with the pink hair, and her brother Semyon, both dead. And the many other nameless young casualties.All entirely blameless, innocent children – just like their entirely blameless, innocent mums and dads – frightened for their lives.  Two weeks ago they were moaning about homework, playing with their friends, not eating their vegetables. Now, suddenly plunged into a reality where growing up without their fathers may well be the best case scenario. The least worst of their horrendous options. When Let It Go lyricist Kristen Anderson-Lopez saw Amelia’s rendition, she tweeted: “Dear Little Girl with the beautul voice, my husband and I wrote this song. The way you sing it is like a magic trick that spreads the light in your heart and heals everyone who hears it.” She finished by urging Amelia to “Keep singing!” If only that choice was hers. title: man called little john who
story: Man called Little John who lives in a cave sees his dad for first time in  yearsThe -year-old lives in a cave in Otago, New Zealand performs dentistry on himself and doesnt collect any benefit to surviveLittle John, who has lived in a cave for a decade, has been reunited with his dad after  years Image: stuff.co.nzByLucy SkouldingFreelance writer:,  Mar |commentsA man called aposLittle Johnapos who has lived in a cave for the last decade has been reunited with his dad for the first time in  years. The -year-old, who lives out in Otago on New Zealandaposs South Island, lives an extraordinary le which involves performing dentistry on himself and not collecting any benefit to survive. There was no particular animosity or argument in the family that broke them apart - but the separation came after the death of Little Johnaposs brother which hit everyone very hard. Little John was battling addictions and watched the collapse of his relationship - and thataposs when he moved out to live in the cave. And he hasnapost moved for the last  years. After publication Stuff shared Little Johnaposs story, his family, including his sister based in Australia, got in touch saying they were so grateful for the words about him.Little Johnaposs sister said: It feels like a weight has been lted, no longer fearing the worst and wondering where he was. It also caused his father, who Stuff agreed not to name and who is based in Dunedin, New Zealand, to contact a foodbank to try to track him down. Michelle Kerr, from the Mosgiel Community Foodbank, told  News it was a huge step for him. Little John explained that he knew his fatheraposs address but hadnapost visited him since he moved to the South.  But on Wednesdaythe father and son were finally reunited after  years apart. Little Johnaposs dad said it was a wonderful experience. The pair enjoyed a meal and spent quality time together - Little John even spoke to his sister in Australia. Little John even found out his mother had died in . The father and son decided they plan to see each other again in the future.  Living several kilometers away from the closest human structure, Little John said itaposs there that he found peace with God and became close with his fellow Christians.Little John himself said the Stuff article had helped him too as he has been able to form bonds with local residents. Where previously they were wary of picking him up, he can now hitchhike. And a few weeks ago Little John said he heard people calling his name who had obviously gone looking for him. Struggling to find his cave at first, they began calling his name, to which he replied Gaposday. Little John said he had had some offers from hopeful aposcave womenapos, but not as many as he wanted. He particularly likes the cold months in the Otago caves and plans to spend winter there. Explaining why he lives in the cave he said for me itaposs natural, and natural is healthy.  He also doesnapost want to claim the unemployment benefit or eventually the pension because he said the money would give him access to his addictions. Little John explained heaposs always had a problem with booze and smokes but now he smokes and drinks much less basically because he canapost afford it. He has given up on Government support, come off the dole and closed his bank account in what he describes as a really big step. Doing odd jobs and using food banks, he gets by on around  a year. Little John added that he lives in a cave because itaposs free but also because nobody bugs him there.
